intro: Serapias nurrica var. alba, commonly known as the white serapias, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually basal and pinnately divided, with a hairy texture. Serapias nurrica var. alba is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
